definitions: abbreviated form of December used in dates and calendars
examples: The conference is scheduled for Dec fifteenth
Please mark Dec twenty-fifth on your calendar

definitions: state of moral decay characterized by excessive self-indulgence and declining standards
examples: The empire fell into decadence after centuries of prosperity
Critics saw the lavish parties as signs of societal decadence

definitions: someone who indulges in excessive luxury or moral decay
examples: The decadent spent fortunes on frivolous pleasures
Victorian writers often portrayed decadents as tragic figures

definitions: design or picture that can be transferred from special paper onto another surface
examples: She applied a flower decal to her laptop cover
The model airplane needs decals for authentic markings

definitions: act of cutting off the head from the body as execution or injury
examples: Medieval executions often involved public decapitation
The accident resulted in the mannequin's decapitation

definitions: athletic contest consisting of ten different track and field events over two days
examples: He trained for years to compete in the Olympic decathlon
The decathlon tests both speed and endurance in athletes

definitions: process of gradually breaking down or declining in quality over time
breakdown of organic matter through natural biological processes
examples: Urban decay left many buildings abandoned and crumbling
The old infrastructure showed signs of serious decay
Tooth decay requires immediate dental treatment
Fallen leaves undergo decay on the forest floor

definitions: person who has died, especially one recently dead
examples: The deceased left a substantial inheritance to charity
Family members gathered to honor the deceased

definitions: person who has died, used specifically in legal contexts
examples: The decedent's estate was divided among three heirs
Lawyers reviewed the decedent's will for proper execution

definitions: act of deliberately misleading or lying to gain unfair advantage
examples: His deceit was exposed when documents proved otherwise
Years of deceit destroyed their business partnership completely

definitions: person who deliberately misleads or tricks others
examples: The deceiver convinced dozens to invest in fake schemes
She realized too late that he was a skilled deceiver

definitions: process of slowing down or reducing velocity
examples: The car's rapid deceleration prevented a serious accident
Economic deceleration worried investors about future growth

definitions: quality of being morally appropriate and conforming to accepted standards
examples: Common decency requires helping those in obvious need
She had the decency to apologize for her mistake

definitions: transfer of authority from central government to regional or local levels
examples: The country pursued decentralisation to empower local communities
Administrative decentralisation improved regional service delivery

definitions: transfer of authority from central government to regional or local levels
examples: Corporate decentralization gave branch managers more autonomy
The reform included significant decentralization of decision making

definitions: act of deliberately causing someone to believe something false
examples: The spy's deception fooled enemy intelligence for months
Marketing deception can result in serious legal penalties

definitions: unit for measuring the intensity of sound or power level of electrical signals
examples: Concert noise levels exceeded ninety decibels
The new regulations limit workplace noise to eighty-five decibels

definitions: act of making a choice or reaching a conclusion about something
examples: The deciding took longer than anyone expected
Careful deciding prevents costly mistakes later

definitions: number expressed in the base-ten system using a decimal point
examples: Convert the fraction to a decimal for easier calculation
The decimal goes to three places after the point

definitions: destruction of a large portion of something, originally one-tenth
examples: Disease caused the decimation of native populations
The storm's decimation of crops threatened food security

definitions: process of converting coded or unclear text into understandable form
examples: The decipherment of ancient scripts revealed lost history
Successful decipherment required years of patient analysis

definitions: something having a specified number of levels or floors
examples: The double decker bus toured through London streets
They lived in a three decker house near the harbor

definitions: formal speech delivered with strong emotion or rhetorical effect
examples: His passionate declamation moved the entire audience
Students practiced declamation for the speech competition

definitions: player in bridge who plays both their hand and dummy's hand
person who makes an official or formal statement
examples: The declarer needed three more tricks to make contract
South became declarer after winning the bidding
The declarer must submit forms before the deadline
Each declarer signed the customs documents

definitions: act of politely refusing an invitation or offer
angular distance of a celestial object from the celestial equator
examples: Her declination of the job offer surprised everyone
He sent a formal declination to the wedding invitation
The star's declination helps astronomers locate it precisely
Magnetic declination varies depending on geographic location

definitions: decorative art style of 1920s-1930s featuring geometric patterns and bold designs
examples: The hotel lobby featured stunning deco architectural details
She collected vintage deco jewelry from estate sales

definitions: device that converts coded signals into understandable form
examples: The cable decoder unscrambles encrypted television channels
Install the decoder to receive digital broadcast signals

definitions: process of converting coded information into its original form
examples: Message decoding requires the correct encryption key
The decoding of genetic sequences revolutionized medicine

definitions: process by which colonies become independent from colonial powers
examples: African decolonisation accelerated after World War Two
The museum exhibits document the country's decolonisation

definitions: process by which colonies become independent from colonial powers
examples: Decolonization reshaped the global political landscape significantly
The peaceful decolonization avoided widespread conflict

definitions: process of decay where organic matter breaks down into simpler substances
examples: Bacterial decomposition enriches soil with vital nutrients
The rate of decomposition depends on temperature and moisture

definitions: reduction of pressure, especially on the body after diving or flying
examples: Divers need careful decompression to avoid the bends
The decompression chamber helps treat diving accidents

definitions: critical analysis method that questions traditional assumptions about meaning and truth
process of carefully taking apart a building or structure
examples: Literary deconstruction challenges conventional text interpretations
His deconstruction of the argument revealed hidden assumptions
Building deconstruction allows materials to be recycled
The careful deconstruction preserved historic architectural elements

definitions: process of removing dangerous substances like chemicals or radiation from people or places
examples: Emergency decontamination procedures were activated immediately
The decontamination of the site took several months

definitions: style of decoration and furnishings in a room or building
examples: The restaurant's modern decor attracted younger customers
She updated the decor with contemporary furniture pieces

definitions: item used to make something more attractive or festive
medal or award given for achievement or service
examples: Holiday decorations filled every corner of the house
The decoration on the cake made it look professional
The soldier received a decoration for exceptional bravery
Military decorations were displayed in the museum case

definitions: person who plans and arranges the furnishing and decoration of interiors
examples: The decorator suggested bold colors for the living room
We hired a decorator to redesign our office space

definitions: behavior that is appropriate and in good taste for a situation
examples: Parliamentary decorum requires members to address the speaker
She maintained perfect decorum throughout the formal dinner

definitions: object or person used to lure others into a trap or distract attention
examples: Hunters placed a decoy duck on the pond
The police used a decoy car to catch thieves

definitions: official order issued by a legal authority or government
examples: The king's decree banned public gatherings
The court decree required immediate compliance

definitions: process of converting encrypted data back into its original readable form
examples: Data decryption requires the correct password or key
The decryption of enemy messages provided vital intelligence

definitions: quality of being committed to a task or purpose with determination
words written as a tribute in a book or on a monument
examples: Her dedication to teaching inspired countless students
Success requires dedication and consistent hard work
The book's dedication thanked his supportive family
They unveiled the monument's dedication at the ceremony

definitions: amount paid out of pocket before insurance coverage begins paying for services
examples: The health insurance deductible was five hundred dollars
Higher deductibles usually mean lower monthly premiums

definitions: process of reaching a conclusion through logical reasoning from general principles
amount taken away from a total, especially from taxable income
examples: Sherlock Holmes was famous for his brilliant deductions
Through careful deduction, she solved the complex puzzle
Charitable contributions qualify as tax deductions
The payroll deduction covered health insurance costs

definitions: legal document that transfers ownership of property
action that is performed intentionally or consciously
examples: The deed clearly showed the property boundaries
They signed the deed at the lawyer's office
His brave deed saved three people from drowning
Good deeds often inspire others to act kindly

definitions: process of becoming deeper or more intense in physical or abstract sense
examples: The deepening of the harbor allows larger ships
Their relationship experienced a gradual deepening over time

definitions: act of making false statements that damage someone's reputation
examples: The newspaper faced defamation charges for false reporting
Online defamation can have serious legal consequences

definitions: person or group that has lost a contest, battle, or struggle
examples: The defeated accepted the terms of surrender gracefully
Support programs helped the defeated rebuild their lives

definitions: discharge of feces from the body as a normal biological process
examples: Regular defecation is important for digestive health
The medical chart tracked the patient's defecation patterns
